definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Shows the trestle-trees, cross-trees, and the eye bolts for the futtock shrouds .
sentences.chinese: 树状支架，树状十字及为连接上下桅的铁索的眼螺栓。

sentences.english: She is also the largest four-masted sailing ship in the world still afloat.
sentences.chinese: 目前，她还是世界上最大的仍未沉没的四桅帆船。

sentences.english: O ship is steadied by thy spars.
sentences.chinese: 哦，航船平稳都依靠你的樯桅。

sentences.english: Reflection Of Sailboat Masts In Lake Maggiore, Locarno, Switzerland.
sentences.chinese: 帆船桅倒映在湖面上，洛迦诺，瑞士。

sentences.english: Tall ship sails down the Seine River.
sentences.chinese: 高桅帆船沿着塞纳河向下航行。

sentences.english: What is your draft and what is your air draft?
sentences.chinese: 你船的吃水和连桅高度是多少？

sentences.english: Here’s another example of a sloop with a Bermuda rig.
sentences.chinese: 这是另一个使用百慕大帆的单桅帆船的例子。

sentences.english: So it becomes very necessary to study the wind load effect on the tower and mast structure.
sentences.chinese: 因此对塔桅这类特型结构进行风荷载研究很有必要。

definition: sail/Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布[fan1 bu4] canvas
the bow or prow of a ship
ancient warship/see 艨艟, ancient leatherclad warship
side of a ship or an aircraft
scull (single oar worked from side to side over the stern of a boat) (free word)
